skill.name: git-workflow
skill.description: Git workflow and pull request specialist. Use when creating PRs, managing branches, establishing git conventions, or improving code review processes.
skill.summary: Git workflow and pull request specialist. Use when creating PRs, managing branches, establishing git...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown files defining git workflow best practices and PR templates. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle with inconsistent pull requests that lack context and slow down reviews. This skill provides structured templates, branch naming conventions, and merge strategies to streamline your git workflow.
actual_capabilities: Creates well-structured pull requests following conventional formats
Establishes branch naming conventions for team consistency
Defines PR templates and checklists for quality reviews
Recommends appropriate merge strategies based on context
Guides through rebasing and conflict resolution
Documents breaking changes with migration steps
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly
Does not integrate with GitHub or GitLab APIs
Does not automate PR creation or merging
Does not enforce policies through git hooks

use_cases.title: Standardize team PRs
use_cases.description: Establish consistent pull request templates and branch naming across your development team.

use_cases.title: Improve contributor PRs
use_cases.description: Guide contributors to submit well-documented pull requests with clear test plans.

use_cases.title: Define merge strategies
use_cases.description: Choose the right merge strategy for each branch type and document conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Create feature PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a pull request for a new feature called user authentication. Include a clear title, summary of changes, test plan, and checklist.

prompt_templates.title: Fix bug PR
prompt_templates.prompt: I fixed a bug where login failed on mobile devices. Create a bug fix PR template with root cause analysis and regression test plan.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor PR
prompt_templates.prompt: I refactored the database utility module. Help me write a refactor PR that confirms no behavior changes and existing tests pass.

prompt_templates.title: Document breaking change
prompt_templates.prompt: Our API signature changed from oldMethod() to newMethod(options). Create breaking changes documentation with migration guide.

output_examples.input: Help me create a pull request for a new feature that adds OAuth2 login.
output: Summary: Adds Google and GitHub OAuth2 login options. Users can now sign in with their existing accounts. Session management updated for persistent login.
Test Plan: Add unit tests for OAuth flow, integration tests with mock provider, manual testing with real OAuth accounts.
Checklist: Code follows style guidelines, self-review completed, documentation updated, no new warnings.

best_practices: Use conventional commit format in PR titles for automated changelog generation
Include specific test plans with step-by-step instructions and expected results
Document breaking changes with clear before/after examples and migration steps
anti_patterns: Submitting PRs with vague titles like 'fix stuff' or 'updates'
Missing test plans or copy-pasting generic checklists without specificity
Forgetting to link related issues or document why the change was needed

faq.question: What tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for generating PR content and git guidance.

faq.question: Are there limits on PR complexity?
faq.answer: The skill handles PRs of any size but recommends splitting very large changes into smaller, focused PRs.

faq.question: Does this integrate with Git hosting platforms?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill. It generates content but does not directly call GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket APIs.

faq.question: Is my code or data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only generates text templates. No code, credentials, or repository data is stored or transmitted.

faq.question: What if templates do not match my project?
faq.answer: Templates are starting points. Adjust types, scopes, and checklist items to match your projects and team conventions.

faq.question: How is this different from git commit hooks?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and templates. Git hooks enforce rules automatically during the development workflow.
